publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6901 Bill Kidd: Bravehearts of Scotland and Panjaabâ€”That the Parliament welcomes the second historic Scottish-Sikh event celebrating 300 years of a Sikh Braveheart, Banda Singh Bahadur (1670-1716), the Sikh equivalent of William Wallace (1272-1305) at a public event at the Smith Art Gallery and Museum in Stirling on 4 September 2010, which will bring together the stunning sword displays of the Baba Deep Singh Gatka Akhaara and the traditional Scottish skills of the Clan Wallace; notes that, as well as speeches, bagpipes, turban tieing and traditional Sikh food, there will be a presentation of pictures to the gallery, a celebration of all things Scottish and Sikh and of the contribution that Sikhs have made to Scotland over many years and a coming together of two peoples with much in common, and expresses thanks to the Sikh Community Action Network and to the people of Stirling for making all of this possible. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Stuart McMillan*, Rob Gibson*, Murdo Fraser*, Aileen Campbell*
S3M-6901 Bravehearts of Scotland and Panjaab (lodged on 2 September 2010) Brian Adam*, Alasdair Allan*
S3M-6901 Bravehearts of Scotland and Panjaab (lodged on 2 September 2010) Jamie Hepburn*, Gil Paterson*
